title: Green Bathrooms Are Trending, Here’s How To Get The Look
description: We can’t help but notice an upswing in green bathrooms recently. We’re not just talking about a few green tiles, these are fully colour-drenched, head-to-toe green bathrooms that are as verdant as the scenes out their mottled-glass windows. Discover how to get the look with our top picks from our Design Directory!
author: The Design Files
excerpt: Browse our top picks in tiles, lighting, stone, fixtures and fittings for a serene, colour-drenched bathroom.
text: You’ll often hear that a bathroom should be restful — a place to retreat to. And whilst beautiful towels, soft lighting and luxurious soaps can help to set the scene, what completely transforms a space into a sanctuary, is colour. Green is one of the best hues for the job, whether it’s soft mint, moody sage or warm olive. To envelop your space with these verdant, nature-inspired tones, take your tiles from the floor to the ceiling and wrap them around the entire room (paint can also have the same effect). Bring in texture through a benchtop made from concrete, terrazzo or natural stone with a beautiful vein. Add some subtle contrast to the space with metal fixtures and  tapware. Green is surprisingly versatile and pairs well with classic bright silver tapware, brushed gunmetal or a warmer brass or bronze finish. Wall lights are the perfect accent and finishing touch in a moody, colour drenched bathroom space – choose a circular sconce (or two!) in either ceramic or glass. Green also pairs beautifully with timber, which is a great option for your vanity. Texture is everything with this serene, colour-drenched look, bring it into the space with finishing touches like handmade ceramics and soft, luxurious towels. Additional moodboard credits (from left): Josephine Hand Towel in Sage and Chalk from Baina. Tracy Muirhead — Small ‘Pebble Bowl’ in Muted Grey Burnt Earth from Craft Victoria.
